title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:18 <Enygma`> has quit  
00:21 <junhan> has joined #xwiki  
00:28 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
00:28 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: How's the release going?  
00:28 <+mflorea> maven part is done  
00:32 <junhan> has left #xwiki  
00:34 <mflorea> has quit  
00:34 <+cjdelisle> http://xwiki.pastebay.com/118109  
00:34 <+cjdelisle> venturing into a new space with cache logging on  
00:35 <+cjdelisle> interesting it's looking up documents called colibri and albitross.  
00:36 <@sdumitriu> What's with the 5 at the start?  
00:36 <@sdumitriu> 5:xwiki17:Scheduler.colibri0:  
00:36 <@sdumitriu> And with the 0 at the end  
00:37 <@sdumitriu> (and the 17 in the middle)  
00:37 <+cjdelisle> Oh, I modded my code for generating the key to use bencoding to make collisiuons impossoble.  
00:37 <+cjdelisle> \*impossible  
00:38 <+cjdelisle> I had to recompile anyway since by default, debug logging dumps out way too much info  
00:43 <prprabhu> has joined #xwiki  
00:44 <jvelociter> has quit  
00:45 <jstoldt> has joined #xwiki  
00:46 <+cjdelisle> http://xwiki.pastebay.com/118111  
00:47 <+cjdelisle>  /skin/ is comparitively expensive  
00:47 <jstoldt|Notebook> has quit  
00:47 <+cjdelisle> probably even more expensive than just using a skin extension.  
01:03 <+cjdelisle> hmm looks like jssx with ?language=en causes 2 db hits  
01:03 <+cjdelisle> 2011-03-23 19:54:04,131 [http://127.0.0.1:8081/xwikiTrunk/bin/jsx/XWiki/WebDAV?language=en] [http://127.0.0.1:8081/xwikiTrunk/bin/jsx/XWiki/WebDAV?language=en] DEBUG store.XWikiCacheStore           - Cache: put doc 5:xwiki12:XWiki.WebDAV0: in cache  
01:03 <+cjdelisle> 2011-03-23 19:54:04,133 [http://127.0.0.1:8081/xwikiTrunk/bin/jsx/XWiki/WebDAV?language=en] [http://127.0.0.1:8081/xwikiTrunk/bin/jsx/XWiki/WebDAV?language=en] DEBUG store.XWikiCacheStore           - Cache: put doc 5:xwiki12:XWiki.WebDAV2:en in cache

09:49 <+lucaa> mflorea: so I can commit again, the rel is done?  
09:49 <+mflorea> the maven part is done, so yes, you can commit  
09:49 <+lucaa> ok. I'll commit fixes in 3.0 as well  
09:50 <+mflorea> go ahead  
10:12 <marta\_> has quit  
10:39 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <jstoldt> morning  
10:42 <vmassol> morning  
10:44 <jstoldt> sent you the link to my machine... note that it's gonna be shit slow :-D  
10:45 <vmassol> jstoldt: :) send it here and it'll be really slow...  
10:45 <vmassol> indeed your machine is slow  
10:46 <jstoldt> told you. ;) max upload is 24 kB/s  
10:46 <jstoldt> ;)  
10:46 <vmassol> jstoldt: IMO you could use the container macro to have 2 columns maybe  
10:47 <jstoldt> hmmm you mean in order to make the content area consistently wide?  
10:47 <vmassol> yes  
10:47 <vmassol> looks nice overall … some content bugs  
10:47 <vmassol> would be nice if clicking in the menu didn't refresh the whole page  
10:47 <jstoldt> i think that won't be possible  
10:48 <jstoldt> not with the code of the admin app  
10:48 <vmassol> in any case it's already very nice  
10:48 <vmassol> is it maintainable?  
10:48 <jstoldt> thanks  
10:48 <vmassol> (for the content)  
10:48 <jstoldt> i tried to make it maintainable  
10:49 <jstoldt> this is actually something i'd like to discuss with you  
10:49 <jstoldt> it probably best if i explain what i did  
10:49 <jstoldt> so the layout is this, the XWikiSyntax is just the page that puts together all the content.  
10:50 <jstoldt> it generates the navigation items and headings for the content  
10:50 <jstoldt> each sections content is stored on a single page  
10:50 <vmassol> so one page per section content  
10:50 <jstoldt> and each of those pages has a level 5 heading that holds information about the version  
10:50 <vmassol> ?  
10:50 <jstoldt> exactly  
10:51 <vmassol> what is a section?  
10:51 <jstoldt> so for instance for the links i got three sections, "10", "20" and "21"  
10:51 <vmassol> "editing" ?  
10:51 <vmassol> or "paragraphs"  
10:51 <vmassol> ?  
10:51 <jstoldt> nope, Paragraphs  
10:51 <vmassol> ok  
10:51 <jstoldt> editing is a category  
10:51 <vmassol> ok  
10:52 <+tmortagne> a nice thing could maybe be to make it a bit more dynamic and make XWikiSyntax discover the sections pages based on an xclass  
10:52 <jstoldt> anyway, the three sections within a content page are used to include the content for the proper syntax version  
10:53 <jstoldt> within the content map (in code at the beginning) i got some markers that tell the code when the section should be available or if the section for a previous version should be loaded  
10:53 <jstoldt> tmortagne: i would have like that  
10:53 <jstoldt> but somebody said that would require PR  
10:53 <+tmortagne> why ?  
10:53 <jstoldt> and i didn't want to go to those extents for the Syntax page  
10:54 <+tmortagne> you can search document with a xclass based where clause  
10:55 <xipe> has quit  
10:55 <jstoldt> that would be nice to have because then i could remove the information from the map and add it dynamically  
10:55 <+tmortagne> that's one of the most commons request used in XE (getting the list of panels, users, etc..) and it does not need PR  
10:56 <jstoldt> oh  
10:56 <jstoldt> the section pages  
10:56 <jstoldt> my bad  
10:56 <jstoldt> i thought you said sections  
10:56 <+tmortagne> yep  
10:56 <+tmortagne> what is the difference ?  
10:57 <+tmortagne> let me reread what you said  
10:58 <jstoldt> XWikiSyntaxNew > Category (virtual entity) > Section page (XWikiSyntaxParagraphs page) > Sections (===== 10 ===== or ===== 20 ===== or ===== 21 ===== headings that will be included into XWikiSyntaxNew)  
10:58 <+tmortagne> i understood "each sections content is stored on a single page" as one section being one page  
10:59 <jstoldt> content wise one page holds one section but from the wording one page can hold multiple sections that represent different revisions of content  
10:59 <vmassol> going to start upgrade of myxwiki.org to 3.0RC1  
11:00 <jstoldt> that will be nice! then i can work there or something  
11:00 <+tmortagne> jstoldt: anyway i need to look at details but if you have read right on pages you should be able to do something dynamic without PR  
11:01 <+tmortagne> vmassol: same comment than vmassol on the two columns  
11:01 <+tmortagne> s/vmassol:/jstoldt:/  
11:01 <jstoldt> the question is if i can figure out which sections (i.e. which headings) exist on the Section page  
11:02 <+tmortagne> but it looks nice :)  
11:02 <+tmortagne> jstoldt: depends how section are stored in a page  
11:02 <jstoldt> because without the information for what to look for the code won't work as it works now and we would need more redundancy  
11:03 <+tmortagne> can't youhave only one section by page ? would be too overkill ?  
11:03 <jstoldt> like i said, a level 5 heading that reads either 10, 20 or 21 (according to version) and after that the displayed content  
11:03 <jstoldt> right now i am just hiding the h5 headings  
11:03 <+tmortagne> or you mean subsections ?  
11:03 <jstoldt> i actually did the current design in order to not use even more pages  
11:03 <vmassol> hmmm myxwiki.org seems very slow  
11:04 <xipe> has joined #xwiki  
11:04 <jstoldt> subsections is (a section below the 10, 20 or 21) is another problem i ran into but i got that working dynamically, alright  
11:06 <+lucaa> guys, I get this in the console of a very fresh build of 3.1  
11:06 <+lucaa> 2011-03-24 10:58:35,387 [http://localhost:8090/xwiki/bin/jsx/XWiki/WebDAV?language=en] WARN  sx.JsExtension                  - Failed to compress JS extension: String index out of range: 1569  
11:06 <+lucaa> 2011-03-24 10:58:35,406 [http://localhost:8090/xwiki/bin/jsx/AnnotationCode/Settings?language=en] WARN  sx.JsExtension                  - Failed to compress JS extension: String index out of range: 2438  
11:06 <+lucaa> 2011-03-24 10:58:35,424 [http://localhost:8090/xwiki/bin/jsx/XWiki/SharePage?language=en] WARN  sx.JsExtension                  - Failed to compress JS extension: String index out of range: 3712  
11:06 <+lucaa> 2011-03-24 10:58:35,435 [http://localhost:8090/xwiki/bin/jsx/Main/Activity?language=en] WARN  sx.JsExtension                  - Failed to compress JS extension: String index out of range: 4668  
11:06 <+lucaa> 2011-03-24 10:58:35,485 [http://localhost:8090/xwiki/bin/jsx/AnnotationCode/Script?language=en] WARN  sx.JsExtension                  - Failed to compress JS extension: String index out of range: 30345  
11:07 <+tmortagne> jstoldt: at least you could put in the sections object the sections in that page instead of doing the general map in XWikiSyntax page  
11:07 <+lucaa> that's basically all the extensions in documents on that page...  
11:07 <jstoldt> so yeah, i could make one page per section and version but that would increase the number of pages from 22 to something above 40 even now  
11:07 <+lucaa> sdumitriu: any idea?  
11:07 <@sdumitriu> No  
11:07 <DrLou> has quit  
11:07 <@sdumitriu> Could be the upgrade to yuicompressor?  
11:08 <+lucaa> we upgraded yuicompressor?  
11:08 <jstoldt> tmortagne: you mean use the same sections everywhere and not use a map?  
11:08 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
11:08 <jstoldt> everywhere = all section pages  
11:08 <+tmortagne> jstoldt: I mean let each page indicate what it contains in an object  
11:09 <+tmortagne> and the create your map based on it  
11:09 <xipe> has quit  
11:09 <xipe> has joined #xwiki  
11:09 <jstoldt> that sounds interesting but that will just push the problem back a little, won't it?  
11:09 <jstoldt> right now i got it all in one place  
11:09 <+lucaa> sdumitriu: I'm gonna try to just the old one one in the cp, see what happens  
11:10 <jstoldt> your idea would bring it closer to the content, thought  
11:10 <jstoldt> -t  
11:10 <+tmortagne> jstoldt: i will make it dynamic, i.e. easy to add any section  
11:10 <+tmortagne> s/i:it/  
11:10 <+tmortagne> without touching XWikiSyntax page  
11:11 <+tmortagne> you can imagine for example someone documenting some custom transformation in there  
11:11 <jstoldt> okay, that would require us to store section name, min and max version in an object  
11:11 <jstoldt> and section  
11:11 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: what should I write to send a message to a group ? XWiki.GroupName doesn't seem to work  
11:11 <+lucaa> sdumitriu: right, all minified alright now  
11:11 <jstoldt> has quit  
11:13 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: It should  
11:13 <jstoldt|Notebook> has joined #xwiki  
11:13 <+tmortagne> jstoldt: if all you need is being able to find section in a document we can easily add some getSection() method in public Document api since the rendering API is a bit hard to use in velocity since it needs to create java object and stuff like that for now  
11:13 <jstoldt|Notebook> whoops...  
11:13 <jstoldt|Notebook> tmortagne: that would be awesome  
11:13 <jstoldt|Notebook> and definately help  
11:14 <+tmortagne> this method already exists in XWikiDocument, it's not not linked in Document but there is no secutity issue by making it  
11:14 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: works. was a case sensitivity issue  
11:14 <jstoldt|Notebook> okay, so that would help my cause a great deal  
11:15 <+tmortagne> jstoldt|Notebook: could you create a jira issue about that and i will take care of it  
11:15 <jstoldt|Notebook> sure  
11:15 <+lucaa> vmassol: it seems yuicompressor 2.4.2 causes some errors on my local, preventing all jsx to be minified. How do you advise to handle this? reopen 6148 ?  
11:15 <+lucaa> XWIKI-6148  
11:16 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: is there any place where I can see the users who follow me ?  
11:16 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: No, but that's planned  
11:16 <+sburjan> ok  
11:19 <jstoldt|Notebook> tmortagne: just to be sure, getSection currently only retrieves a given section by name, right? or is there also a way to get a map of all sections?  
11:19 <jstoldt|Notebook> because that might be even more useful  
11:19 <+tmortagne> jstoldt|Notebook: it return a list of all section in a document content  
11:19 <+tmortagne> then you can do your map in velocity  
11:19 <jstoldt|Notebook> okay  
11:19 <jstoldt|Notebook> does that list contain information about the levels?  
11:20 <+tmortagne> it returns a list of https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-core/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/api/DocumentSection.java to be more precise  
11:20 <vmassol> lucaa: yes reopen since it's for 3.1M1  
11:20 <vmassol> (which isn't released)  
11:20 <+lucaa> ok  
11:21 <jstoldt|Notebook> splendid!  
11:21 <+tmortagne> jstoldt|Notebook: weird thing is that it's an API class used only in protected API currently  :)  
11:21 <+tmortagne> but good for me, don't have to refactor anything ;)  
11:21 <jstoldt|Notebook> :)  
11:22 <jstoldt|Notebook> XWIKI-6168  
11:24 <vmassol> tmortagne, jvelociter: ok for me to remove old versions in myxwiki.org's xwiki-backups?  
11:25 <+jvelociter> fine by me  
11:25 <+tmortagne> sure  
11:25 <+tmortagne> jstoldt|Notebook: thanks  
11:25 <+jvelociter> (+ we have them anyway)  
11:25 <+jvelociter> (in backups)  
11:25 <jstoldt|Notebook> you're welcome  
11:25 <vmassol> ah ok  
11:28 <jstoldt|Notebook> what do you think about this layout: http://pastebin.com/wHvEvSVr  
11:28 <jstoldt|Notebook> level 3 heading would be category and level 4 heading would be pretty name for the section  
11:29 <jstoldt|Notebook> this way we can dynamically create new categories and sections by just creating a new document that has a layout like that  
11:30 <+tmortagne> jstoldt|Notebook: you plan to have more that one category in a page ? otherwise you can put the category in the object which is probably easier  
11:30 <vmassol> mflorea: make sure to mention that there are changes to be made in web.xml for 3.0RC1  
11:30 <vmassol> (in the RN)  
11:31 <vmassol> for the com.xpn change  
11:31 <+mflorea> ok  
11:31 <vmassol> I can see that while upgrading myxwiki.org  
11:31 <vmassol> ....  
11:31 <jstoldt|Notebook> no, just one category per page. the idea to use a section is that this way we don't have to switch the editor and it's very easy to change the name of the category in a translation  
11:32 <jstoldt|Notebook> you just need to put the same category pretty name in all of the pages on l10n  
11:32 <+tmortagne> jstoldt|Notebook: good point, did not though about translations  
11:32 <jstoldt|Notebook> hehe  
11:32 <@sdumitriu> jvelociter: XWIKI-6096  
11:33 <jstoldt|Notebook> yeah, they've been a bit of a headache from the beginning... although i don't know if the current way would work now  
11:33 <+tmortagne> jstoldt|Notebook: committed  
11:33 <jstoldt|Notebook> great  
11:34 <jstoldt|Notebook> will just wait for the next hudson rebuild and then proceed  
11:34 <vmassol> tmortagne: don't you think we should expose getXDOM instead?  
11:34 <vmassol> (or a copy of it)  
11:37 <+tmortagne> vmassol: at some point we will but it's way too hard to use in velocity right now  
11:37 <vmassol> yes I know, was thinking about a script service too  
11:37 <+tmortagne> impossible to search in it without creating a java object for example  
11:38 <+jvelociter> sdumitriu: closed  
11:39 <+jvelociter> improved my stats  
11:40 <vmassol> jvelociter: we need a nice skol when we stop apache on myxwii.org  
11:40 <vmassol> ....  
11:40 <vmassol> have a look now, it's not nic  
11:40 <vmassol> nice  
11:41 <abusenius> has quit  
11:41 <+jvelociter> vmassol: then we won't be shutting down apache :)  
11:41 <+jvelociter> (but changing it's conf)  
11:48 <+mflorea> vmassol: I forgot to update the parent pom version. Thanks for fixing it.  
11:49 <vmassol> np

12:15 <venkatesh> has joined #xwiki  
12:16 <venkatesh> has quit

12:25 <vmassol> spring cleaning?  
12:25 <@sdumitriu> Yep  
12:26 <jstoldt|Notebook> when will the next snapshot or the RC be built?  
12:26 <vmassol> jstoldt|Notebook: someone needs to add it to jenkins  
12:27 <jstoldt|Notebook> oh so it's not built automatically every n hours?  
12:27 <jstoldt|Notebook> interesting  
12:27 <vmassol> it is  
12:27 <vmassol> not every  n hours  
12:27 <vmassol> at each commit  
12:27 <vmassol> but we've just created a new branch

12:27 <+tmortagne> so it need a new ci job for this branch  
12:27 <jstoldt|Notebook> the rc1 branch?  
12:28 <vmassol> no  
12:28 <vmassol> the 3.0 branch  
12:28 <jstoldt|Notebook> ah, i see  
12:28 <kasun> has quit  
12:28 <vmassol> trunk is now 3.1-SNAPSHOT  
12:28 <jstoldt|Notebook> well, could you add it? ;)  
12:28 <jstoldt|Notebook> i see  
12:28 <vmassol> busy  
12:28 <vmassol> right now  
12:28 <+tmortagne> jstoldt|Notebook: doing it  
12:29 <jstoldt|Notebook> great, thanks  
12:39 <vmassol> upgrade done  
12:39 <vmassol> lunch  
12:40 <+tmortagne> jstoldt|Notebook: done  
12:40 <jstoldt|Notebook> great, thakns  
12:40 <jstoldt|Notebook> \*thanks  
12:40 <jstoldt|Notebook> will download the new snapshot later  
12:41 <kasun> has joined #xwiki  
12:42 <mflorea> has quit  
12:51 <+cjdelisle> Can someone tell me exactly how xwiki.org cluster (I assume it's a cluster) is set up?  
12:52 <+cjdelisle> Are all of the "non-master" installations just caches?  
12:52 <+cjdelisle> It makes no sense that there would be multiple databases since I just don't see the infrastructure to support it.  
13:02 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
13:07 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
13:13 <@sdumitriu> jvelociter: XWIKI-6100

13:22 <+jvelociter> damn it  
13:46 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki

14:07 <+cjdelisle> jira is going slow too which makes very little sense  
14:09 <+sburjan> lucaa: I found a small issue on dashboards.  
14:11 <+lucaa> sburjan yes?  
14:12 <+sburjan> Steps: I add a Gadget. (let's say a box or code macro). I move its position. I edit the Gadget and change its content. => The Gadget goes back in its initial position  
14:13 <+lucaa> it's reported  
14:13 <+sburjan> ok  
14:13 <+lucaa> http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-6150  
14:14 <+lucaa> it's not that easy to fix, therefore I decided to postpone it until somebody really complains  
14:14 <+sburjan> ok. I'm not complaining  
15:18 <lucaa> has quit  
15:25 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki

15:30 <@sdumitriu> Yes

17:07 <+cjdelisle> re XAADMINISTRATION-258 I just don't like it. What you are calling a workaround is IMO better design.  
17:08 <+cjdelisle> IMO as much code as possible should be sandboxed and code requiring permissions should be as small and well reviewed as possible.  
17:08 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: I think the debate will be closed only when we will introduce signed code ;)  
17:09 <+cjdelisle> Code outside of the sandbox should interact with code inside of the sandbox by providing APIs.  
17:09 <+cjdelisle> Re {{signed}}, this also has me concerned. I'm worried that adding {{signed}} will cause a proliferation of PR code everywhere because it will become much easier to do.  
17:10 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: it's not an API issue, there is all needed API in this case  
17:10 <+tmortagne> but not anyone case use API which does dangerous things like installing a jar  
17:11 <+cjdelisle> So does that mean the extension manager can be tricked with an {{include}} macro to add jars for anyone?

17:12 <+tmortagne> s/use//  
17:13 <+cjdelisle> So it checks for admin permission on the viewer?  
17:13 <+tmortagne> yes

17:14 <+cjdelisle> What I would have done is use a groovy script to add a script service to $services which does the check and adds the jar when asked.  
17:14 <+cjdelisle> then {{include}} the page with the groovy script.  
17:15 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: there is a service, i don't understand what groovy as to do with that§  
17:15 <+cjdelisle> Well, the part which needs PR can add a script service so that it can be called by the part which is sandboxed.  
17:15 <+tmortagne> if you don't require programming right on the page author anyone can call the API and wait for an admin to access the page  
17:16 <+tmortagne> it's not all about the viewer

17:16 <+tmortagne> plus without PR i don't see how you expect to execute groovy...  
17:17 <+cjdelisle> The included page can have PR right/
